Description: Cats are small, carnivorous mammals that are often kept as pets. They are known for their agility and playful behavior.
Dogs are domesticated mammals, not natural wild animals. They were originally bred from wolves.
Lions are large carnivorous mammals that belong to the family of big cats. They are known as the king of the jungle.
Tigers are the largest cat species in the world reaching up to 3.3 meters in length and weighing up to 670 pounds.
Elephants are large mammals of the family Elephantidae and the order Proboscidea. They are known for their large ears and long trunks.
Giraffes are the tallest land animals on earth, known for their long necks and legs, and their distinctive coat patterns.
Zebras are African equines with distinctive black-and-white striped coats. They are social animals that live in herds.
Monkeys are primates that are generally considered to be intelligent and are found in a variety of habitats worldwide.
Kangaroos are large marsupials that are found only in Australia. They are known for their powerful hind legs and large feet.
Pandas are bear-like animals that are native to China. They are known for their distinctive black and white fur and their diet of bamboo.
Koalas are arboreal herbivorous marsupials native to Australia. They are known for their large noses and eucalyptus diet.
Cheetahs are large cats that are known for their incredible speed, capable of running up to 70 miles per hour.
Leopards are large cats known for their beautiful spotted coats. They are solitary animals that live in a variety of habitats.
Wolves are large carnivorous mammals that are the ancestors of domestic dogs. They live and hunt in packs.
Foxes are small to medium-sized omnivorous mammals belonging to several genera of the family Canidae.
Bears are large mammals of the family Ursidae. They are found in a variety of habitats and are known for their strength.
Rabbits are small mammals in the family Leporidae. They are known for their long ears and short, fluffy tails.
Deer are hoofed ruminant mammals forming the family Cervidae. They are known for their antlers, which are shed and regrown each year.
Horses are large mammals of the family Equidae. They have been domesticated by humans for thousands of years.
Cows are large domesticated ungulates. They are raised for their milk, meat, and hides.
Sheep are domesticated ruminant mammals typically kept as livestock. They are known for their woolly fleece.
Goats are domesticated ruminants raised for their milk, meat, and hides. They are known for their agility and intelligence.
Pigs are domesticated mammals typically raised for their meat. They are known for their intelligence and social behavior.
Chickens are domesticated birds that are raised for their meat and eggs. They are one of the most common and widespread domestic animals.
Ducks are waterfowl birds that are known for their broad bodies and webbed feet. They are found in both freshwater and seawater.
Geese are large waterfowl birds that are known for their migratory patterns. They are commonly found near bodies of water.
Turkeys are large birds that are native to North America. They are known for their fan-shaped tails and wattled necks.
Parrots are colorful birds that are known for their ability to mimic human speech. They are found in tropical and subtropical regions.
Sparrows are small, plump birds that are found worldwide. They are known for their adaptability to urban environments.
Pigeons are stout-bodied birds that are commonly found in cities and towns. They are known for their ability to find their way home over long distances.
Penguins are flightless birds that are adapted to life in the water. They are known for their distinctive black and white plumage.
Ostriches are large flightless birds that are native to Africa. They are known for their long necks and powerful legs.
Eagles are large birds of prey that are known for their keen eyesight and powerful flight. They are found in many parts of the world.
Hawks are birds of prey that are known for their sharp talons and beaks. They are found in a variety of habitats.
Falcons are birds of prey that are known for their speed and hunting prowess. They are found on every continent except Antarctica.
Vultures are scavenging birds of prey that are known for their bald heads and strong beaks. They play an important role in the ecosystem.
Bats are the only mammals capable of sustained flight. They are known for their echolocation abilities and nocturnal habits.
Dolphins are highly intelligent marine mammals that are known for their playful behavior and complex social structures.
Whales are large marine mammals that are known for their impressive size and complex songs. They are found in oceans worldwide.
Sharks are a group of fish that are known for their cartilaginous skeletons and sharp teeth. They are found in all seas.
Octopuses are cephalopods known for their intelligence, eight arms, and ability to camouflage. They are found in various ocean habitats.
Squids are cephalopods known for their elongated bodies, large eyes, and tentacles. They are found in oceans worldwide.
Crabs are crustaceans known for their hard exoskeleton and pincers. They are found in oceans, freshwater, and on land.
Lobsters are large marine crustaceans known for their long bodies, muscular tails, and claws. They are found in oceans worldwide.
Starfish are echinoderms known for their star-shaped bodies and ability to regenerate limbs. They are found in all the world's oceans.
Jellyfish are gelatinous marine animals known for their bell-shaped bodies and tentacles. They are found in oceans worldwide.
Seals are marine mammals known for their streamlined bodies and flippers. They are found in both polar and temperate waters.
Sea lions are marine mammals known for their external ear flaps and ability to 'walk' on land using their flippers. They are found in various ocean habitats.
Walruses are large marine mammals known for their tusks and whiskers. They are found in the Arctic Ocean and subarctic seas.
Otters are semiaquatic mammals known for their playful behavior and dexterity. They are found in various water habitats worldwide.
Beavers are large, nocturnal, semiaquatic rodents known for building dams, canals, and lodges. They are found in North America and Europe.
Raccoons are medium-sized mammals known for their dexterous front paws and facial masks. They are native to North America.
Skunks are small to medium-sized mammals known for their ability to spray a foul-smelling liquid as a defense mechanism. They are found in the Americas.
Hedgehogs are small mammals known for their spiny coats and ability to roll into a ball for protection. They are found in Europe, Asia, and Africa.
Porcupines are large rodents known for their coat of sharp quills. They are found in various habitats across the Americas, Africa, and Asia.
Squirrels are small to medium-sized rodents known for their bushy tails and agility. They are found in various habitats worldwide.
Chipmunks are small, striped rodents known for their cheek pouches and burrowing habits. They are found in North America and Asia.
Mice are small rodents known for their adaptability and reproductive rate. They are found in nearly every part of the world.
Rats are medium-sized rodents known for their intelligence and adaptability. They are found in various habitats worldwide.
Hamsters are small rodents often kept as pets. They are known for their cheek pouches and burrowing habits.
Guinea pigs are small, social rodents often kept as pets. They are known for their vocalizations and friendly nature.
Chinchillas are small rodents known for their dense, soft fur. They are native to the Andes mountains in South America.
Hares are larger than rabbits and are known for their long ears and powerful hind legs. They are found in various habitats worldwide.
Moose are the largest species of the deer family. They are known for their broad, palmate antlers. They are found in northern regions of North America and Eurasia.
Elk are large members of the deer family known for their impressive antlers and bugling calls. They are found in North America and eastern Asia.
Reindeer, also known as caribou, are known for their antlers and ability to live in Arctic and subarctic regions. They are found in northern Europe, Siberia, and North America.
Buffalo are large bovines known for their horns and rugged appearance. They are found in Africa and Asia.
Bison are large, grazing mammals known for their hump and massive head. They are found in North America and Europe.
Yaks are long-haired bovines found in the Himalayan region. They are known for their ability to live at high altitudes.
Camels are large mammals known for their humps, which store fat. They are found in desert regions of Africa and Asia.
Llamas are domesticated South American camelids known for their wool and ability to carry loads. They are native to the Andes mountains.
Alpacas are domesticated South American camelids known for their soft wool. They are closely related to llamas and are found in the Andes mountains.
Hippopotamuses are large, mostly herbivorous mammals known for their large mouths and semi-aquatic lifestyle. They are found in sub-Saharan Africa.
Rhinoceroses are large, herbivorous mammals known for their thick skin and horns. They are found in Africa and Asia.
Crocodiles are large aquatic reptiles known for their powerful jaws and stealth. They are found in tropical regions worldwide.
Alligators are large reptiles similar to crocodiles but with a broader snout. They are found in the United States and China.
Lizards are a widespread group of squamate reptiles with over 6,000 species. They are found in various habitats worldwide.
Geckos are small, nocturnal lizards known for their vocalizations and ability to climb smooth surfaces. They are found in warm climates worldwide.
Iguanas are large, herbivorous lizards known for their crest of spines along their backs. They are found in Central and South America.
Chameleons are lizards known for their ability to change color and their independently mobile eyes. They are found in Africa, Madagascar, and southern Europe.
Frogs are amphibians known for their jumping abilities, croaking sounds, and smooth skin. They are found worldwide.
Toads are amphibians similar to frogs but with drier, bumpier skin. They are found in various habitats worldwide.
Newts are amphibians known for their ability to regenerate limbs and their aquatic larval stage. They are found in North America, Europe, and Asia.
Salamanders are amphibians known for their lizard-like appearance and ability to regenerate limbs. They are found in the Northern Hemisphere.
Snakes are elongated, legless reptiles known for their flexible bodies and carnivorous diet. They are found in various habitats worldwide.
Pythons are large, nonvenomous snakes known for their constricting method of hunting. They are found in Africa, Asia, and Australia.
Cobras are venomous snakes known for their hooded appearance and intimidating posture. They are found in Africa and Asia.
Vipers are venomous snakes known for their long, hinged fangs. They are found in various regions worldwide.
Tortoises are land-dwelling reptiles known for their long lifespans and protective shells. They are found in various habitats worldwide.
Turtles are reptiles known for their bony or cartilaginous shells. They are found in both aquatic and terrestrial habitats worldwide.
Snails are mollusks known for their coiled shells and slow movement. They are found in various habitats worldwide.
Slugs are similar to snails but lack a prominent shell. They are found in various habitats worldwide.
Ants are social insects known for their complex colonies and cooperative behavior. They are found in almost every land habitat on Earth.
Bees are flying insects known for their role in pollination and producing honey. They are found in various habitats worldwide.
Wasps are flying insects known for their stingers and role as predators of other insects. They are found in various habitats worldwide.
Hornets are large, aggressive wasps known for their painful stings. They are found in various habitats worldwide.
Butterflies are insects known for their colorful wings and metamorphosis from caterpillars. They are found in various habitats worldwide.
Moths are insects similar to butterflies but are typically nocturnal. They are found in various habitats worldwide.
